Tests.Name: Dependency to Digital Certificates

TestCase.Name: Dependency to Digital Certificates

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify the IdP **Service Certificate** is valid and part of the Mission Trust List.
**Example with Certutil:** _certutil -urlcache http://example.com_ _certutil -url cert.cer_
**Example with PowerShell:** _$uri = "https://example.com"_ _$request = \[System.Net.HttpWebRequest\]::Create($uri)_ _$request.GetResponse() | select Certificate_
**Example with OpenSSL:** openssl s\_client -connect example.com:443 -showcerts openssl x509 -noout -text -in cert.pem
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The IdP **Service Certificate** is valid and part of Trust List in Network.

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify revocation of the IdP **Service Certificate**
**Example with Certutil:** _certutil -verify -urlfetch C:\\certs\\mycertificate.cer_
**Example with PowerShell:** _$certificate = \[System.Net.HttpWebRequest\]::Create($uri).ServicePoint.Certificate_ _$chain = New-Object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Chain_ _$chain.Build($certificate)_ $chain.ChainStatus
**Example with OpenSSL:** openssl verify -crl\_check -crl\_download -CAfile chain.pem cert.cer
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The IdP **Service Certificate** completed the revocation check successfully.

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify the IdP **Token-Signing Certificate** is valid and part of the Mission Trust List.
Using the same example as Step 1.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The IdP **Token-Signing Certificate** is valid and part of Trust List in Network.

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify revocation of the IdP **Token-Signing Certificate.**
Using the same example as Step 2.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The IdP **Token-Signing Certificate** completed the revocation check successfully.

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify the IdP **Token-Decryption Certificate** is valid and part of the Mission Trust List.
Using the same example as Step 1.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The IdP **Token-Decryption Certificate** is valid and part of Trust List in Network.

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify revocation of the IdP **Token-Decryption Certificate.**
Using the same example as Step 2.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The IdP **Token-Decryption Certificate** completed the revocation check successfully.

Tests.Name: Local Identity Provider (IdP) must log authentication attempts

TestCase.Name: Local Identity Provider (IdP) must log authentication attempts

TestSteps.StepAction: User attempts authentication on IdP.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: Authentication process works.

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify that the IdP Service logged the user authentication attempt.
Event logs must include, as a minimum: user authentication attempts; and records of issued tokens, such as identification of the Relying Party (url), of Service Consumer (IP address) and the user identifier provided in the token (account attempting to use the service).
**Example for ADFS:** _Set-AdfsProperties -LogLevel Verbose_ _Set-AdfsProperties -AuditLevel Verbose_
_Get-WinEvent -FilterHashtable @{LogName='Security';Id=411} | Select-Object -First 20 | Format-List_
_Open_ **_Event Viewer_**_._ _Navigate to_ **_Applications and Services Logs_** _\\>_ **_AD FS_** _\\>_ **_Admin_**_._ _Look for events related to claim issuance._
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The IdP Service is logging user authentication attempts with atleast the minimum requirements.

Tests.Name: Dependency to Domain Naming

TestCase.Name: Dependency to Domain Naming

TestSteps.StepAction: Open a DNS-client within the MNPs own system.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: DNS-client is present.

TestSteps.StepAction:
Execute a **Forward Lookup** on the correct DNS-record (A or CNAME) for the Identity Provider Service:
_Example for Windows:_ **_nslookup <Unique Identifier for IdP Service>_**
_Example for Linux:_ **_dig A <Unique Identifier for IdP Service>_**
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: Forward Lookup resolved the correct IP-address / alias for the IdP Service and match the values defined in the JMEI.

TestSteps.StepAction:
Execute a **Reverse Lookup** on the correct DNS-record (PTR) for the Identity Provider Service:
_Example for Windows:_ **_nslookup <IP-address for IdP Service>_**
_Example for Linux:_ **_dig -x <IP-address for IdP Service>_**
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: Reverse Lookup resolved the correct Unique Identifier value for the IdP Service and match the values defined in the JMEI.

Tests.Name: Dependency to Distributed Time

TestCase.Name: Dependency to Distributed Time

TestSteps.StepAction: Access and log into the Identity Provider Service.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: MNP is able to connect

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify the **time-zone** configured on the Identity Provider Service.
_Example for Windows:_ **_tzutil /g_** **_Get-TimeZone_**
_Example for Linux (depends on distribution):_ **timedatectl**
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The time-zone should be the same as defined in the JMEI for Distributed Time. Normally this is defined as "**UTC**"

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify the **date and time** configured on the Identity Provider Service.
_Example for Windows:_ **_w32tm /query /status_** **_Get-Date_**
_Example for Linux:_ **date** **timedatectl**
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The time and date should correct and synchronised from the correct source in your local NTP-design.

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify the **stratum level** configured on the Identity Provider Service.
_Example for Windows:_ **_w32tm /query /status_**
_Example for Linux:_ **ntpq -p** **timedatectl show-timesync --all** **chronyc tracking**
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The stratum level should not exceed the value defined in the JMEI for Distributed Time. Normally this is defined to maximum "**Stratum 4**".

Tests.Name: Local Identity Provider (IdP) Federation Metadata

TestCase.Name: Local Identity Provider (IdP) Federation Metadata

TestSteps.StepAction:
Download the Federation Metadata XML-file and open in your preferred text-editor.
**Example with ADFS:** _curl -o FederationMetadata.xml https://<adfs-server-domain>/FederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml_
**Example with KeyCloak:** _curl -o keycloak\_metadata.xml https://<keycloak-server-domain>/auth/realms/<realm-name>/protocol/saml/descriptor_
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The Federation Metadata is successfully downloaded as an XML-file and readable.

TestSteps.StepAction: Verify that the Federation Metadata XML-file contains **<IDPSSODescriptor>** and **<SPSSODescriptor>** with **protocolSupportEnumeration_\=_"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:protocol"**
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The Federation Metadata XML-file contains **<IDPSSODescriptor>** and **<SPSSODescriptor>.**

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify that the Federation Metadata XML-file contains information about the **IdP Unique Identifier (FQDN)** defined in the JMEI.
**Example with ADFS:** _<EntityDescriptor entityID="https://idp.example.com/adfs/services/trust">_
**Example with KeyCloak:** _<EntityDescriptor entityID="https://<keycloak-server-domain>/auth/realms/<realm-name>/protocol/saml">_
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The Federation Metadata contains the **IdP Unique Identifier (FQDN)** defined in the JMEI within **<EntityDescriptor>.**

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify that the Federation Metadata XML-file contains bindings for **HTTP-Redirect** within **SAML 2.0** **Binding** in **<IDPSSODescriptor>.**
**Example with ADFS:** _<SingleSignOnService Binding="urn:oasis:names:tc:_**_SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-Redirect_**_" Location="https://idp.example.com/adfs/services/trust"/>_ _<SingleLogoutService Binding="urn:oasis:names:tc:_**_SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-Redirect_**_" Location="https://idp.example.com/adfs/services/trust"/>_
**Example with KeyCloak:** _<SingleSignOnService Binding="urn:oasis:names:tc:_**_SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-Redirect_**_" Location="https://keycloak.example.com/auth/realms/<realm-name>/protocol/saml"/>_ _<SingleLogoutService Binding="urn:oasis:names:tc:_**_SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-Redirect_**_" Location="https://idp.example.com/adfs/services/trust"/>_
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The Federation Metadata contains the **HTTP-Redirect** within **SAML 2.0** **Binding** within **<SingleSignOnService>** and **<SingleLogoutService>**

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify that the Federation Metadata XML-file contains bindings for **HTTP-POST within SAML 2.0 Binding** in **<IDPSSODescriptor>.**
**Example with ADFS:** _<SingleSignOnService Binding="urn:oasis:names:tc:_**_SAML:2.0:bindings/HTTP-POST_**_" Location="https://idp.example.com/adfs/services/trust"/>_
**Example with KeyCloak:** _<SingleSignOnService Binding="urn:oasis:names:tc:_**_SAML:2.0:bindings/HTTP-POST_**_" Location="https://keycloak.example.com/auth/realms/<realm-name>/protocol/saml"/>_
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The Federation Metadata contains the **HTTP-POST** within **SAML 2.0** **Binding** within **<SingleSignOnService>.**

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify that the Federation Metadata XML-file contains the **Unique Identifier Claim** and as a minimum the **Mandatory** **Claims** defined in the JMEI.
**Example for ADFS:** _<Attribute Name="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress" NameFormat="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:attrname-format:uri" />_
**Example for KeyCloak:** _<RequestedAttribute Name="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress" NameFormat="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:attrname-format:uri" />_
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The Federation Metadata contains **Unique Identifier Claim** and as a minimum the **Mandatory Claims.**

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify that the Federation Metadata XML-file contains the correct **Token-Signing Certificate.**
**_<KeyDescriptor use="signing">_** _<KeyInfo xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#">_ _<X509Data>_ _<X509Certificate>_ _MIICoTCCAYk…<trimmed\_certificate\_data>…==_ _</X509Certificate>_ _</X509Data>_ _</KeyInfo>_ _</KeyDescriptor>_
Copy the content inside <X509Certificate> and save it to a file (e.g., idp\_certificate.pem) with the following structure. _\-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----_ _MIICoTCCAYk…<certificate\_data>…==_ _\-----END CERTIFICATE-----_
Verify that the certificate is part of the Trust List for the Network.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The Federation Metadata contains **Token-Signing Certificate** that is part of the Trust List for the Network within **<KeyDescriptor>**

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify that the Federation Metadata XML-file contains the correct **Token-Encryption** **Certificate.**
**_<KeyDescriptor use="encryption">_** _<KeyInfo xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#">_ _<X509Data>_ _<X509Certificate>_ _MIICoTCCAYk…<trimmed\_certificate\_data>…==_ _</X509Certificate>_ _</X509Data>_ _</KeyInfo>_ _</KeyDescriptor>_
Copy the content inside <X509Certificate> and save it to a file (e.g., idp\_certificate.pem) with the following structure. _\-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----_ _MIICoTCCAYk…<certificate\_data>…==_ _\-----END CERTIFICATE-----_
Verify that the certificate is part of the Trust List for the Network.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The Federation Metadata contains **Token-Encryption Certificate** that is part of the Trust List for the Network within **<KeyDescriptor>**

Tests.Name: Dependency to Digital Certificates

TestCase.Name: Dependency to Digital Certificates

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify the IdP **Service Certificate** is valid and part of the Mission Trust List.
**Example with Certutil:** _certutil -urlcache http://example.com_ _certutil -url cert.cer_
**Example with PowerShell:** _$uri = "https://example.com"_ _$request = \[System.Net.HttpWebRequest\]::Create($uri)_ _$request.GetResponse() | select Certificate_
**Example with OpenSSL:** openssl s\_client -connect example.com:443 -showcerts openssl x509 -noout -text -in cert.pem
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The IdP **Service Certificate** is valid and part of Trust List in Network.

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify revocation of the IdP **Service Certificate**
**Example with Certutil:** _certutil -verify -urlfetch C:\\certs\\mycertificate.cer_
**Example with PowerShell:** _$certificate = \[System.Net.HttpWebRequest\]::Create($uri).ServicePoint.Certificate_ _$chain = New-Object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Chain_ _$chain.Build($certificate)_ $chain.ChainStatus
**Example with OpenSSL:** openssl verify -crl\_check -crl\_download -CAfile chain.pem cert.cer
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The IdP **Service Certificate** completed the revocation check successfully.

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify the IdP **Token-Signing Certificate** is valid and part of the Mission Trust List.
Using the same example as Step 1.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The IdP **Token-Signing Certificate** is valid and part of Trust List in Network.

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify revocation of the IdP **Token-Signing Certificate.**
Using the same example as Step 2.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The IdP **Token-Signing Certificate** completed the revocation check successfully.

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify the IdP **Token-Decryption Certificate** is valid and part of the Mission Trust List.
Using the same example as Step 1.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The IdP **Token-Decryption Certificate** is valid and part of Trust List in Network.

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify revocation of the IdP **Token-Decryption Certificate.**
Using the same example as Step 2.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The IdP **Token-Decryption Certificate** completed the revocation check successfully.

Tests.Name: Verify the Joining and Exiting Mission Instruction (JMEI) from SMA

TestCase.Name: Verify the Joining and Exiting Mission Instruction (JMEI) from SMA

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify that the required content is provided within the JMEI:
* Defined a **topology decision** between Full-Mesh and Hub-Spoke * Includes the **federation topology** with all MNPs * Defined the **Unique Identifier Claim** * Defined **Mandatory**/Recommended/Optional **Claim** * Includes the **IDP Unique Identifier (FQDN)** for all MNPs * Includes the **IdP Federation Metadata (URL)** for all MNPs * Includes values for **Quality of Service (QoS)** * Defined the use of **encrypted** **security tokens**
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The required information is collected, decided and provided by the Service Lead in the JMEI.

Tests.Name: Local Identity Provider (IdP) must use HTTPS

TestCase.Name: Local Identity Provider (IdP) must use HTTPS

TestSteps.StepAction:
Verify that the **IDP Service is using HTTPS**, and HTTP is not available.
_NOTE! Remember that the port can be different based on the MNPs configuration. This should be stated in the JMEI._
**Example with PowerShell:** _Test-NetConnection -ComputerName <IDP Service Unique Identifier URL> -Port 443_ _Test-NetConnection -ComputerName <IDP Service Unique Identifier URL> -Port 80_
**Example with Curl:** curl -v _<IDP Service Unique Identifier URL>_
**Example with Netcat:** nc -zv _<IDP Service Unique Identifier URL>_ 443 nc -zv _<IDP Service Unique Identifier URL>_ 80
**Example with Nmap:** nmap -p 443,80 _<IDP Service Unique Identifier URL>_
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: IDP Service is responding on port 443. IDP Service is **NOT** responding on port 80.

Tests.Name: Local Identity Provider (IdP) must configure Quality of Service (QoS)

TestCase.Name: Local Identity Provider (IdP) must configure Quality of Service (QoS)

TestSteps.StepAction:
Log into device that marks the Web Authentication traffic. This can both be at the application layer or the firewall.
Please describe how your system is handling the QoS-marking in the result for this step.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: Description of how the system is handling QoS-marking.

TestSteps.StepAction: Verify that QoS-marking is configured correctly based on the information within the JMEI.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The QoS-marking is configured as defined in the JMEI.

TestPlans.Name: TT-SI-Service Management and Control - Federation basics

Tests.Name: Spiral 5 - SMC - INC - Create Incident

TestCase.Name: Spiral 5 - SMC - INC - Create Incident

TestSteps.StepAction: The service consumer system sends an Incident with the mandatory attributes to the endpoint of the service provider system.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: A well-formed Incident in FMN SMC Incident Management OpenAPI format was sent to the service provider system

TestSteps.StepAction: The service provider system responds to the new Incident and confirms the successful creation of the Incident in the response.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: A well-formed response in FMN SMC Incident Management OpenAPI format was sent back to the requesting service consumer system

TestSteps.StepAction: The service provider system sends a notification of the incident to all known subscribers to its Incident Management API.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: An incident notification is sent to subscribing systems.

TestSteps.StepAction: The service consumer system checks whether a valid response was received.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome:
*   The received HTTP response code indicates a successful creation of the Incident in the service provider system
*   The content of the response is well-formed according to the FMN SMC Incident Management OpenAPI format

TestSteps.StepAction: The subscribing system verifies the receiving of the notification incident.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome:
The incident notification has been received in the subscribing system.
The received HTTP response code indicates a successful creation(notification) of the Incident in the service provider system
The content of the response is well-formed according to the FMN SMC Incident Management OpenAPI format

Tests.Name: Spiral 5 - SMC - INC - Register Incident Listener

TestCase.Name: Spiral 5 - SMC - INC - Register Incident Listener

TestSteps.StepAction: The service consumer system sends an Incident subscription with the mandatory attributes to the endpoint of the service provider system.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: A well-formed request in FMN SMC Incident Management OpenAPI format was sent to the service provider system

TestSteps.StepAction: The service provider system responds to the subscription request and sends a confirmation of a successful registration in the response.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: A well-formed response in FMN SMC Incident Management OpenAPI format was sent back to the requesting service consumer system

TestSteps.StepAction: The service consumer system checks whether a valid response was received.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome:
* The received HTTP response code indicates a successful registration of the listener in the service provider system
* The content of the response is well-formed according to the FMN SMC Incident Management OpenAPI format

Tests.Name: Spiral 5 - SMC - INC - Add Note to Incident

TestCase.Name: Spiral 5 - SMC - INC - Add Note to Incident

TestSteps.StepAction: The service consumer system sends a Note for an existing Incident to the endpoint of the service provider system.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: A well-formed request in FMN SMC Incident Management OpenAPI format was sent to the service provider system

TestSteps.StepAction: The service provider system responds to the Add Note request and sends a confirmation in the response that the Note has been successfully added to the Incident.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: A well-formed response in FMN SMC Incident Management OpenAPI format was sent back to the requesting service consumer system

TestSteps.StepAction: The service provider system sends a notification of the update (note) on the incident to all known subscribers to its Incident Management API.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The note update is sent to the subscribing systems.

TestSteps.StepAction: The service consumer system checks whether a valid response was received.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The received HTTP response code indicates that the Note has been successfully added to the existing Incident in the service provider system.

TestSteps.StepAction: The subscriber system checks whether a valid response was received.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: The received HTTP response code indicates that the Note has been successfully added to the existing Incident in the service provider system.

Tests.Name: Spiral 5 - SMC - SCM - Register Service Catalogue Listener

TestCase.Name: Spiral 5 - SMC - SCM - Register Service Catalogue Listener

TestSteps.StepAction: The source system sends a Service Catalogue subscription with the mandatory attributes to the endpoint of the target system.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome:
* A well-formed request in FMN SMC Service Catalogue Management OpenAPI format was sent to the target system
* A well-formed response in FMN SMC Service Catalogue Management OpenAPI format was sent back to the requesting source system
* The received HTTP response code indicates a successful registration of the listener in the target system
* The content of the response is well-formed according to the FMN SMC Service Catalogue Management OpenAPI format.

TestSteps.StepAction: After successful registration of the listener in the target system, subscription is created automatically.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: FMN SMC Service Catalogue Management API Subscription for the source system exists in the target system.

Tests.Name: Spiral 5 - SMC - INC - List Incidents

TestCase.Name: Spiral 5 - SMC - INC - List Incidents

TestSteps.StepAction: The service consumer system queries a list of Incidents that meet a filter condition via the endpoint of the service provider system.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: A well-formed request in FMN SMC Incident Management OpenAPI format was sent to the service provider system

TestSteps.StepAction: The service provider system responds to the query and sends the Incidents that meet the filter conditions with all attributes in the response.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: A well-formed response in FMN SMC Incident Management OpenAPI format was sent back to the requesting service consumer system

TestSteps.StepAction: The service consumer system checks whether a valid response was received.
TestSteps.ExpectedOutcome: * The received HTTP response code indicates successful processing of the query request in the service provider system * The content of the response is well-formed according to the FMN SMC Incident Management OpenAPI format

TestSteps.StepAction:
Announce on the phone the current UTC time Hour: Minutes: Seconds

*   it will voice over the last 10 seconds
*   it will announce Time Hack after the 10 seconds
